name: release
trans: to drop, or to stop carrying, holding, or containing something

name: shield
trans: to protect someone or something

name: intrinsic
trans: basic to a thing, being an important part of making it what it is

name: underground
trans: below the surface of the earth; below ground

name: centerpiece
trans: the most important part of something

name: pedestrian
trans: a person who is walking, esp. in an area where vehicles go

name: clog
trans: to become blocked or filled so that movement or activity is slowed or stopped, or to cause this to happen

name: disruptive
trans: tending to damage the orderly control of a situation

name: vent
trans: an opening that allows air, smoke, or gas to escape or enter an enclosed space

name: operation
trans: a mathematical process, such as addition, in which one set of numbers is produced from another

name: destruction
trans: the action of destroying something, or the state of being destroyed

name: expand
trans: to increase something in size, number, or importance

name: surface
trans: the outer or top part or layer of something

name: rival
trans: a person, group, or organization competing with others for the same thing or in the same area

name: architecture
trans: the art and science of designing and making buildings, or the style of a building

name: decorate
trans: to add something to an object or place, esp. to make it more attractive

name: showcase
trans: a cabinet, usually of glass, in which objects are kept that are valuable or easily broken

name: utilize
trans: to make use of something

name: headquarters
trans: the main offices or center of operations of an organization, such as the army, police, or a company

name: Spring up
trans: to grow or appear suddenly
